title: Which is most expensive liquid in world? - Quora

response.answer_text: Oh, I got it! It is…..  Gatorade! Just kidding! I don’t even really like it or drink it! But, it’s just me! Well, these are a few but they are different - they are liquids though: Scorpion Venom $39,000,000 per gallon.King Cobra Venom $153,000 per gallon.Lysergic acid diethylamide (LSD) $123,000 per gallon.Horseshoe Crab Blood $60,000 per gallon.Chanel No. 5 $26,000 per gallon.Insulin $9,400* per gallon.Mercury $3,400 per gallon.Black Printer Ink $2,700 per gallon.Well, I’ll also give you a cool fact! You know what! I think, probably by the next 50 years or so, water will become the most expensive liquid! Yeah! Scientists are arguing over it, and they say that there will be a WW3 (I mean World War 3, lol) due to water scarcity due to the depletion of available fresh water. So, yeah, it could become an expensive liquid! Hope you enjoyed the cool fact!

Here I’m not differentiating between a solution of the drugs or a suspension in water. The weights are colossally expensive. The 5 most expensive drugs in the United States Actimmune: $52,321.80 for one month. Actimmune is used to boost the immune system in chronic granulomatous disease. ...Daraprim: $45,000 for one month. ...Cinryze: $44,140.64 for one month. ...Chenodal: $42,570 for one month. ...Myalept: $42,137.60 for one month.On a weight basis these drugs far exceed the price of gold. Some drugs have hit close to the $1 million mark, including a gene therapy, Luxturna, that can restore sight to children with a rare retinal disease. Its price was set at $850,000. A drug to treat hemophilia B that's making its way through the approval process, SPK-9001, could cost $1.5 million.
